content.description: Easy slab route on the far right side of Schoolhouse rock.  The hardest moves are probably just off the ground.  This is a great route for kids to TR, or to teach someone how to lead.
content.location: The furthest route on the right side of Schoolhouse Rock.

content.description: Climbs out the right side of the steepest section of Schoolhouse Rock and follows the left side of a light water stain.  This climb starts off steep and then eases off to slabbier terrain after the first four bolts.
content.protection: 9 bolts with chain anchor at the top
content.location: The anchors for this climb are very shiny and the most visible from the road.  Located in the steepest continuous section of the Schoolhouse Rock slab.

content.description: Easy cobble climbing up the low angled wall.  This route has a couple of portions that come close to vertical and provide the cruxes of the route.
content.protection: Lot of bolts ending at a two bolt anchor
content.location: Just right of Horton Hears a Whowah and maybe 100 feet left of Sea Monkeys.

content.description: Another low angled route on the Schoolhouse Rock.  The crux of this route is just before the first bolt, after that the route feels like you make a move then clip a bolt then make another move, then clip another bolt and just keep doing that until you reach the anchors.  This would be a great first lead for someone since they are basically always on top rope (just stick clip the first bolt).
content.protection: Lots and lots of bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Just to the left of Log Jam, and about twenty feet to the right of a lone hanger with a tag on it.

climbs.name: Dancing Fool
climbs.fa: Josh Gunter and Cristina Amat Di Sanfillippo

content.description: Use your 60m rope, traverse in from the left then blast straight up.  Footholds are abundant, handholds are for balance with the occasional bucket.  The moderate climber should feel like a dancing fool if they are doing it right.
content.protection: 9 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Just left of the steepest section on Schoolhouse Rock.

climbs.name: Dance of the Just Plain Folks
climbs.fa: Josh Gunter and Cristina Amat Di Sanfillippo

content.description: The crux is short and right after the first bolt followed by a few moves to a rest. Then like the rest of this wall you use your feet with the climb easing off the higher you get. The anchors and a few bolts were equipped prior to the 2013 Maple guide book.
content.location: This follows up the middle of a white water streak near the least slabby section of the wall.

content.description: Short powerful 4 bolt affair on the steepest section of Schoolhouse Rock.
content.location: The steepest section of Schoolhouse Rock right off the road.
